page.title: 03LOCAL NEWS,CATON
page.content: The village newsletter,known as "The Link" began in January 1968.It is distributed free to 1200 homes in the Parish by 40 volunteers,each month except August.The cost is met mainly by the advertisers,the Parish council and donations from individuals."The Link" serves to inform the village of all its many activities and to be informative on various subjects such as wildlife,garden care and local history. There is also the occasional reader's letter,poem and devotional article as well as the regular news from St.Paul's Church.The editor is a local Primary teacher. The main local issues have been worries like the state of roads and chlorine in the water.There has been a successful campaign to bring Gas to this village and there is currently a campaign for the construction of a BMX track.
